text: When I first started talking about gay marriage, most people in the gay community looked at me as if I was insane or possibly a fascist reactionary.
author: Andrew Sullivan

text: So I really did stop and change what I saw I was about, and really try to put that principle into play as the center of everything - my friendships, my marriage, my career, my family, my way of being in the world. And that changed everything for me.
author: Kathy Mattea

text: People ask what the secret of a happy marriage is. If there is one, it's 'don't talk about it.'
author: Jane Asher

text: I look back to when I got divorced in the late 1970s. When that happened, I was so broken up. After that, I decided to seek God for my life and my next marriage.
author: Ricky Skaggs

text: I took the fear of marriage from my parents' relationship, because I didn't want to end up in a relationship like that, whereas my brothers and sisters learnt a lesson from it and made sure they didn't carry it on into their own marriages.
author: John Mahoney
